actions.name: convert_units
actions.description: Convert between different units for motorcycle track day use. Supports pressure (PSI/bar), weight (kg/lbs), temperature (°C/°F), length (mm/inches), and spring rate (N/mm to lbs/in).

actions.name: calculate_tire_pressure
actions.description: Calculate tire pressure changes based on temperature or provide pressure recommendations. Converts between cold and hot pressures based on temperature rise, or calculates expected hot pressure from cold starting pressure.

cold_pressure.description: Cold tire pressure in PSI (optional if calculating from hot)

hot_pressure.description: Hot tire pressure in PSI (optional if calculating from cold)

hot_temp.description: Hot temperature in Celsius (or expected hot temp)

calculation_type.description: Type of calculation: cold_to_hot (calculate hot from cold), hot_to_cold (calculate cold from hot), or pressure_rise (calculate expected rise)

actions.name: calculate_spring_rate
actions.description: Calculate recommended spring rate for motorcycle suspension based on rider weight, bike weight, motion ratio, and desired sag. Returns spring rate in both N/mm and lbs/in.

bike_weight_kg.description: Bike weight (kg). If not provided, will use typical values based on bike category.

motion_ratio.description: Motion ratio (wheel travel / shock stroke). Typical: front ~1.0, rear ~2.0-2.5

desired_sag_mm.description: Desired static sag in mm. Typical: front 30-35mm, rear 25-30mm for track use

bike_category.description: Bike category for default motion ratio if not provided (optional)

actions.name: calculate_suspension_geometry
actions.description: Calculate suspension geometry changes (rake, trail, wheelbase) from ride height adjustments. Predicts handling characteristics from geometry changes.

front_height_change_mm.description: Change in front ride height in mm (positive = raise, negative = lower)

rear_height_change_mm.description: Change in rear ride height in mm (positive = raise, negative = lower)

actions.name: analyze_lap_times
actions.description: Analyze lap times, calculate improvements, pace analysis, and consistency metrics. Compares current lap time to previous or target times.

current_lap_time.description: Current lap time in format MM:SS.mmm or M:SS.mmm (e.g., '1:45.234' or '1:45.2')

target_lap_time.description: Target lap time to compare against (optional)

analysis_type.description: Type of analysis: improvement (vs previous), pace (vs target), consistency, or all

notes.implementation: These schemas follow OpenAI's function calling format. When adding to ChatGPT Custom GPT:
steps: 1. Go to ChatGPT → Create → Configure → Actions
4. For manual: Copy the schema for one action at a time
5. You'll need to provide an API endpoint or use Code Interpreter for calculations
notes.important: These are schema definitions. You'll need to either:
options: A) Use Code Interpreter (Python) to perform calculations
B) Create API endpoints that perform the calculations
C) Use ChatGPT's built-in calculation abilities (may work for simple conversions)
notes.recommendation: Start with Unit Conversion - it can work with Code Interpreter or ChatGPT's built-in math. For complex calculations, Code Interpreter is easiest.
